model_outputs.question:

Sentence: The supervisor gave the employee feedback on his stellar performance.
Options:
(A) It was the supervisor's performance
(B) It was the employee's performance
(C) Ambiguous
model_outputs.model_answer:
The antecedent of the pronoun "his" in the given sentence is (B) it was the employee's performance. This is because the pronoun "his" generally refers to a possessive form of a noun, and in this case, the noun being possessed is "performance." It is clear from the sentence that the supervisor gave feedback to the employee, so it makes sense that the pronoun "his" would refer back to the employee.

It is not option (A) because the antecedent "it" would be ambiguous, it is not clear which "it" the pronoun is referring to, and it's not option (B) because the antecedent is "feedback" which is referring to the supervisor's feedback to the employee.
